intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. breviradiatum, commonly known as the short-rayed bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
